History: -year-old woman after stroke with CHF. Assess volume status and possible pneumonia.
Impression: PA and lateral chest compared to through : Severe cardiomegaly is chronic, as is a large hiatus hernia, generally to the right of midline. There is no radiographic evidence of pulmonary edema or pneumonia and no appreciable pleural effusion is present. Thoracic aorta is heavily calcified and tortuous but not focally aneurysmal.
